::: {.week-card}
## Overview
This week students will present their mid-term projects, showcasing the visualization techniques and design principles learned so far. We'll practice giving and receiving constructive feedback on data visualization work.
:::

## Learning Objectives

By the end of this week, you will be able to:

- Present data visualization projects effectively
- Provide constructive feedback on visualization design
- Identify strengths and improvement opportunities in peer work
- Reflect on your own design process and decisions
- Learn from diverse approaches to similar problems

## Presentation Format

ðŸŽ¯ **5-minute presentations** followed by 2-minute Q&A

**Structure your presentation:**
1. Problem/question (30 seconds)
2. Data and approach (1 minute)
3. Design decisions and process (2 minutes)
4. Key insights and findings (1 minute)
5. Reflection and next steps (30 seconds)

## Evaluation Criteria

### Technical Implementation (40%)
- Appropriate chart types for data and questions
- Clean, well-structured code
- Proper data handling and processing
- Effective use of visualization libraries

### Design & Aesthetics (30%)
- Clear visual hierarchy and layout
- Appropriate use of color and typography
- Accessibility considerations
- Professional presentation quality

### Communication (20%)
- Clear problem statement and context
- Logical flow and storytelling
- Effective annotations and explanations
- Engagement with audience questions

### Process & Reflection (10%)
- Documentation of design decisions
- Acknowledgment of limitations
- Learning insights and growth
- Plans for improvement

## Presentation Schedule

**Tuesday Session:**
- Groups 1-8 present
- 15-minute break at midpoint
- Peer feedback forms

**Thursday Session:**
- Groups 9-16 present
- 15-minute break at midpoint
- Course reflection discussion

## Feedback Guidelines

### Giving Feedback
- Focus on design choices, not personal preferences
- Suggest specific improvements
- Highlight what works well
- Ask clarifying questions about decisions
- Be constructive and respectful

### Receiving Feedback
- Listen actively without defending
- Ask follow-up questions for clarity
- Take notes for future reference
- Thank presenters for their perspectives
- Consider feedback in context of your goals
